So I'm in the restroom parting ways with my morning coffee when I realize that I am actively being discriminated against. All of our men's restrooms are equipped with these fancy-schmancy flush-free,"hygienic,"urinals, urlLink http://www.falconwaterfree.com . Basically, the premise of these things is that you piss in a hole of oil and the piss is more dense so it sinks below the oil...that way it doesn't smell. However, there is still piss-residue on the inside of the urinal! What is discriminatory is that this company does not make water-free "sitdown" toilets. Unfortunately, this means that women are not able to help save the environment when they piss, but TRAGICALLY and more importantly, this means I'm not afforded my God-given right to piss in a piss-free toilet. What happens if I piss at the wrong angle???? I could get splashback! And not only is it my piss coming back at me, but it's also the remnants of piss from every other male that pissed in that toilet before me! How degrading! The emotional stress that incurs everytime I have to relieve myself is overwhelming. I think the only thing that can even remotely alleviate these irreparable damages is a multi-million dollar settlement; for both the emotional damage and a few pairs of those Docker's Stain Defender Pants.

Imagine the lost revenue!!! The government really should step up and regulate tissue manufacturing. And don't even get me STARTED on toilet paper...

So I've never felt as lonely as I do now....sitting day in and day out, alone in my house, working on this damn exam. Sure I go to work, but there's something wrong with going to work to get away, you know? What makes it worse is that all my friends are doing the same exact thing, so there is no escape for the next two weeks. Just reading, and writing, and reading, and writing.......I think you get the point. Having all this time gets my mind wandering, thinking about why I'm doing this. That's the scary part...I'm not so sure. I sit back, close my eyes, and think about my dreams. Not the simple "I want to be a doctor" but those mental images you produce, the snapshots of some future event many years from now that you keep with you, that you use as a reminder of how you want things to be and what you're working toward. I don't know why it took as long as it did to realize it, but my dreams, those mental pictures I've been carrying with me for several years and have worked hard to achieve, aren't going to happen. They're empty. Sure they can be modified, but it's not the same. They were a culmination of a series of pieces, like a puzzle I suppose, and when you're missing just one piece, it isn't perfect any longer. What's the point of the puzzle, if it can't be completed? It's a strange feeling, not having any dreams. It's a hollow feeling, a void, like I have no purpose, or goal. It's a temporary situation, I guess, but one I have never actually encountered. In a way, it's interesting. At this point in my life, I'm no longer trying to get the pieces to acheive my dream. Instead, I already have some pieces which allow me to build dreams around them. Unfortunately, major pieces are missing, but I suppose this presents an extraordinary opportunity. I guess the question is: will these dreams be as good as before? And all I can say right now is, I don't know.....that was a damn good dream.

So I've finally have all of my stuff moved into my house. It's still a little disorganized but at least I know where everything is. Unfortunately, I've discovered that the worst thing about moving into a place alone is not having cable hooked up. I get home at night and my only option is to watch PBS, which gets a little old....especially when all they cover is Ronald Reagan. One day of that stuff is enough. Anyway, I've found some solace in my new friend, Ed. Ed's the spider that lives in my bathroom underneath my cabinet. The only reason I have not relocated Ed is because he was living there before I actually moved in, so who am I to kick him out? Besides, it's comforting to see him there when I get up in the morning. I've discovered that having a spider as a friend is nothing like that book, Charlotte's Web. First, Ed doesn't spell cool shit in his web. He doesn't spell anything. In fact, the only shit coming out of his web is HIS shit, and it kind of litters the floor underneath. One advantage of spiders though is that their shit doesn't stink...at least I don't think it does. I have yet to get down there and take a big whiff, though. Ed doesn't say much, either....especially anything wise or enlightening. However, I swear I heard something the other day tell me I needed to cut my toenails. That's just like Ed. Not very smart but he's always thinking of others. It's too bad all spiders are not like Ed, the world would be a much happier place. Here's a picture of Ed with his breakfast that I took with my new camera phone. Really, it was just an excuse to use the camera, but if it immortalizes Ed, then all the better.

So I took the afternoon off yesterday to do a little home improvement and stopped by Lowe's because a little voice told me to the night before......ok, so it was Gene Hackman on the TV but it was damn convincing.....anyway, so I'm in the store, pushing my cart through the aisles when I stopped to look at some bathroom cabinets. Now, I usually consider myself a very courteous cart driver and always move my cart far over to the right, which is what I did, even though I'm the only one in the aisle. I then proceed to check out the cabinents when a rude voice behind me says "excuse me, you're in my way!" I turn around, astonished that somebody is actually that rude and say "pardon me?" It is then that I see this BEHEMOTH woman in one of those little electric carts. So, after my eyes shift to superwide angle, she says "I'm handicapped and I can't get by your cart." Usually I sympathize with the morbidly obese, but this lady picked MY aisle to simply cut through, then proceeded to rudely request that I move my cart because her fucking fat ass can't walk around a damn store, ALL WHILE INHALING ONE OF THOSE LARGE BAGS OF PEANUT M&Ms!!!! This is what killed me. That's like me walking around on crutches claiming to be handicapped while beating myself on the kneecap with a hammer. So I politely say "well, my cart's pulled over as far as it goes." She then says, NOT asks mind you, "well, push it to the end of the aisle" even though I'm about midway through it. Naturally, this flipped my pissed off switch (which usually never happens) so I say, "doesn't that thing have reverse?" and then she says "well I want to go forward." So then I say, "what, do you want me to fucking climb the shelves with my cart on my back?" Keep in mind, I have no Sherpa blood in me whatsoever. I now see that she's either about to throw her thirty pounds of M&Ms at me or eat me for a midafternoon snack so I grab my cart and storm it down the end of the aisle. Then as she past me I told her I hope those M&Ms go straight to her arteries. Needless to say, I didn't buy any cabinets. Instead, I went home and had a beer. Never has a stranger pissed me off so much. I feel guilty because I know I should feel bad but I actually did hope that as she drove her cart off one of those M&Ms would find a way to her heart and plug it causing it to explode. In fact, I still feel that way. Then, when she arrives at those pearly gates, find out that they're not wide enough. THAT would be sweet justice.
